cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 70 miles SSE of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwestward through the Straits of Florida, expected to cross the Lower Florida Keys then turn north-northwest along Florida’s west coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Lower Florida Keys near Key West, FL

weather_observation.watch_coast: No hurricane or tropical-storm watch is posted for southeast Florida; watches begin north of Fernandina Beach toward the South Carolina coast
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from Fernandina Beach southward around the entire Florida peninsula to Indian Pass, including PortMiami; Storm Surge Warning from North Miami Beach southward around the peninsula to the Ochlockonee River
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida east and west coasts, especially the Keys, South Florida (including Biscayne Bay and Miami-Dade), and the Florida west coast up to Tampa Bay
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–73 mph) almost certain, with a 39% chance of sustained 50-kt (58 mph) winds; brief hurricane-force gusts possible Sunday as the eye passes to the southwest.
weather_observation.storm_surge: In Biscayne Bay and the Miami waterfront, water levels could rise 3–5 ft above ground if peak surge coincides with high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: Forecast 8–15 inches with isolated totals up to 20 inches, producing life-threatening flash-flood potential.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes, dangerous surf and rip currents, and debris hazards from high winds impacting port operations.
